definition: to promote knowledge of laws/rights awareness
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Strengthening promulgation of laws; Creating with efforts a good public-opinion environment of copyright protection.
sentences.chinese: 加强版权普法，努力营造良好的版权保护舆论环境。

sentences.english: Education in the law will be further expanded.
To administer centrally the law popularization and education in the customs institutions.
sentences.chinese: 归口管理海关系统的普法教育。

sentences.english: After the Franco-Prussian War, France has been working to restore the country's national economy.
sentences.chinese: 普法战争后，法国一直努力恢复国家的国民经济。

sentences.english: What kind of slogan have we used most in promoting knowledge of the laws?
sentences.chinese: 在我们的普法宣传中，什么口号用的最多？

sentences.english: This church was founded by immigrants from the Palatinate and other German districts of the Reformed faith.
sentences.chinese: 这教堂是由移民普法和德国其他地区的改革信念。

sentences.english: Shang Yangs thought on popularizing laws was one of the important contents of his legal thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 商鞅的普法思想是其法治思想的重要内容之一。

sentences.english: Scott McMahon and Anne Pfaff are both portrait artists.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特麦克马洪和安普法夫都是肖像画艺术家。

definition: rule of law/to rule by law
to rule according to the law
public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
complaint letter/petition letter/see also 上訪|上访[shang4 fang3]
